item.title: MouseLockdown
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You can use tab. I’d get a vid of it but the main concept is just ctrl alt del, and then use the tab and enter to get to processes and then delete scar.exe. If the script clicks and moves the arrows, then it’d be nearly impossible.

Read full topic

item.title: MouseLockdown
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

The Un-Named:

Using alt + f4 with getself.hide dosen’t work. They need to ctrl alt del and end scar.exe.

Which is basically impossible with the mouse moving…

Read full topic

item.title: MouseLockdown

item.description:
@Deathwizards wrote:

wont people just try to press Alt+f4 anyway if the cursor is moving around like crazy?

item.title: MouseLockdown
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[scar]begin
getself.hide
repeat
movemouse(1)
until isfkeydown(5)
getself.show
end.[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: MouseLockdown
item.dc:creator: @marauder1 marauder1
item.description:
@marauder1 wrote:

lolz… i used something along the lines of that and minimised to tray scar in my school, those noobs couldnt ctrl-alt-del or anything cos it autocloses task manager. so in the end, the decided to shutdown the computer manually. lol.

Read full topic

item.title: MouseLockdown
item.dc:creator: @Youngt191 Youngt191
item.description:
@Youngt191 wrote:

Ever want to make sure that nobody else gets on your computer but you don’t want to do it the easy way and log off? Well I’ve got a solution (unless people in your house are smart and know that you have SCAR). Use this program. It simply moves the mouse around like crazy.

To stop press ALT+F4

program MouseScreenSaver; begin repeat MoveMouseSmooth(313,515); MoveMouseSmooth(613,939); MoveMouseSmooth(121,315); MoveMouseSmooth(481,583); MoveMouseSmooth(913,315); MoveMouseSmooth(0,0); MoveMouseSmooth(61,515); MoveMouseSmooth(414,616); Writeln('Repeating...'); until(false) end.

Or if you just want a simple one that moves the mouse to the corner then.

Program Bored; begin repeat MoveMouse(0,0); until(false) end.

Read full topic
